snippet: An Afghan Army commander is said to have brokered a turf-sharing deal with the Taliban, a sign of what may come once international troops withdraw.
abstract: Afghan Army commander stationed in the deadliest corner of Helmand Province is said to have brokered a cease-fire and turf-sharing deal with local Taliban insurgents, raising alarm that it signals the sort of ground-level bargaining to come once international troops withdraw in 2014.

byline.original: By AZAM AHMED and TAIMOOR SHAH
byline.contributor: Azam Ahmed reported from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan. Habib Zahori contributed reporting from Kabul.

lead_paragraph: An Afghan Army commander is said to have brokered a turf-sharing deal with the Taliban, a sign of what may come once international troops withdraw.

headline.main: Local Turf-Sharing Accord With the Taliban Raises Alarm in Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: Local Turf-Sharing Accord With the Taliban Raises Alarm in Afghanistan
